name: VSCode
desc: Deploy Visual Studio Code (VSCode) with a one-click setup to access a powerful, lightweight code editor optimized for building, debugging, and collaborating on modern software projects.
longDesc:
**What is VSCode?**

VSCode is a free, open-source code editor developed by Microsoft. It supports a wide range of programming languages and integrates with frameworks and tools for tasks like debugging, testing, and version control. Itâ€™s known for its flexibility, rich extension ecosystem, and cross-platform availability.

**Key Features:**

- **One-Click Deployment:** Quickly set up VSCode through Docker containers for instant access on any platform.
- **Extensive Language Support:** Built-in support for JavaScript, Python, Java, and more, with additional languages available via extensions.
- **Integrated Tools:** Seamless integration with GitHub, Docker, and cloud services for version control, deployment, and collaboration.
- **Live Collaboration:** Use features like Live Share to collaborate with others in real-time on coding projects.
- **Customizable Workspace:** Configure and extend your development environment using themes, extensions, and profiles tailored to your workflow.
useCases:
- **Developers:** Write, test, and debug code efficiently with language-aware tools and IntelliSense.
- **Enterprises:** Manage complex projects and CI/CD pipelines with built-in Git and Docker tools.
- **Educators and Students:** Use the collaborative tools and built-in terminals for teaching programming and coding exercises.
support:
- **Community and Documentation:** Access guides and resources through the [VSCode documentation](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs) and the [GitHub repository](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-docs).
- **Extensions and Marketplace:** Find tools and add-ons on the [VSCode Marketplace](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com).
- **Help and Troubleshooting:** Explore community forums or consult the official documentation for setup tips, best practices, and troubleshooting help.

 This deployment template highlights the ease of using VSCode on Xnode while focusing on privacy, collaboration, and flexibility through Docker deployment. For more information, visit the [official VSCode documentation](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs)

options.name: connectionToken
options.desc: A secret that must be included with all requests.

options.name: connectionTokenFile
options.desc: Path to a file that contains the connection token.

options.name: extensionsDir
options.desc: Set the root path for extensions.

options.name: extraArguments
options.desc: Additional arguments to pass to openvscode-server.

options.name: extraEnvironment
options.desc: Additional environment variables to pass to openvscode-server.

options.name: extraGroups
options.desc: An array of additional groups for the openvscode-server user.

options.name: extraPackages
options.desc: Additional packages to add to the openvscode-server PATH.

options.name: group
options.desc: The group to run openvscode-server under. By default, a group named openvscode-server will be created.

options.name: host
options.desc: The host name or IP address the server should listen to.

options.name: port
options.desc: The port the server should listen to. If 0 is passed a random free port is picked. If a range in the format num-num is passed, a free port from the range (end inclusive) is selected.
options.type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

options.name: serverDataDir
options.desc: Specifies the directory that server data is kept in.

options.name: socketPath
options.desc: The path to a socket file for the server to listen to.

options.name: telemetryLevel
options.desc: Sets the initial telemetry level. Valid levels are: ‘off’, ‘crash’, ‘error’ and ‘all’.

options.name: user
options.desc: The user to run openvscode-server as. By default, a user named openvscode-server will be created.

options.name: userDataDir
options.desc: Specifies the directory that user data is kept in. Can be used to open multiple distinct instances of Code.

options.name: withoutConnectionToken
options.desc: Run without a connection token. Only use this if the connection is secured by other means.

options.name: openFirewall
options.desc: Whether to open ports in the firewall for this application.
